turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: One effective method is the 'Feynman Technique'. Choose an algorithm, try to explain it in simple terms, as if you were teaching it to someone with no technical background. Identify where you struggle, and then go back to the source material to fill in the gaps. Repeat this process until you can explain the algorithm clearly and confidently. Another good technique is to create flashcards with the algorithm name on one side and its key concepts, advantages, disadvantages, and use cases on the other. Does this help?
